My team has not yet purchased the Ovilus but I have been told that it has t=
he ability to form words that have not been programmed into it.=A0 Since I =
have never used one, I am wondering what are the similarities between the O=
vilus and Frank's Box.=A0 Could it be at all possible that rather than just=
 forming words or sounds based on atmospheric readings, spirits are speakin=
g through the Ovilus as they do Frank's box?=A0 
=A0
I don't mean to sound =
silly or presumptous, but I am very very curious!!=A0 I am looking forward =
to purchasing the Ovilus as well as the puck in the near future!=A0 Thanks =
for any feedback onthe Ovilus!

have had
my puck give words that are not on the list.

Carol B.

> I'm new =
here, but have been into paranormal research for 6 years now.

pe of person that never gets EVP voices with a recorder so
> I thought I wo=
uld experiment with things like the Frank's box and
> Ovilus. I recently go=
t the ovilus and brought it to a cemetery and

 down many years ago. I can not get too

inking I am making stuff up but it
> got fairly wild towards the end of the=
 session. For most of the time

ting out a lot of random
> stuff but it kept mentioning the name Seth. Afte=
r we moved over to the
> field where the church was, the ovilus got a lot m=
ore active and
> started saying relevant words like cross and priest. The O=
vilus was
> MUCH more active when being used by our female member. Towards =
the end
> the Ovilus said I am Seth, and the woman that was with me told Se=
th
> that she did not want to talk to you I've heard bad things about you.
=
> After that the Ovilus said rather nasty things to her and she started
> f=
eeling nauseous and she ripped the headphones off her head. Needless
> to s=
ay we ended the session and got out of there.
>
> Over the course of our in=
vestigation we found that the Ovilus was
> saying many words that are not o=
n the 500 word list, so yesterday I
> did some test recordings to see what =
words would come up and one of
> the first things that came up was: seth bl=
amed rest I am not
> gare demon (all in that order). Needless to say this h=
as me
> concerned that whatever seth is is still with the box so I am not e=
ven
> storing this thing inside of my house. I have an MP3 of the ovilus
> =
saying this.
>
> Also from my experience about 50% of the words it is sayin=
g aren't on
> the list. Chris Fleming has been getting words not on the lis=
t, and
> Barry FitzGerald has stated that just over 50% of the words he is
=
> getting are not on the list. Is there really a much larger list than
> ad=
vertised or is this thing really magic? Highly doubtful IMO.
>
> My most im=
portant question is is anyone else getting the name Seth out

s? How many people use this device here?

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;"><DIV>My team has not yet purchased the Ovilus but I have been told that it has the ability to form words that have not been programmed into it.  Since I have never used one, I am wondering what are the similarities between the Ovilus and Frank's Box.  Could it be at all possible that rather than just forming words or sounds based on atmospheric readings, spirits are speaking through the Ovilus as they do Frank's box?  </DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>I don't mean to sound silly or presumptous, but I am very very curious!!  I am looking forward to purchasing the Ovilus as well as the puck in the near future!  Thanks for any feedback onthe Ovilus!</DIV>

<DIV>I have a puck, and I have been getting the name Seth too. I also have had<BR>my puck give words that are not on the list.<BR><BR>Carol B.<BR><BR>> I'm new here, but have been into paranormal research for 6 years now.<BR>> I am the type of person that never gets EVP voices with a recorder so<BR>> I thought I would experiment with things like the Frank's box and<BR>> Ovilus. I recently got the ovilus and brought it to a cemetery and<BR>> field where a church burned down many years ago. I can not get too<BR>> specific without having people thinking I am making stuff up but it<BR>> got fairly wild towards the end of the session. For most of the time<BR>> we were there the Ovilus seemed to be spitting out a lot of random<BR>> stuff but it kept mentioning the name Seth. After we moved over to the<BR>> field where the church was, the ovilus got a lot more active and<BR>> started saying relevant words like cross and priest.
 The Ovilus was<BR>> MUCH more active when being used by our female member. Towards the end<BR>> the Ovilus said I am Seth, and the woman that was with me told Seth<BR>> that she did not want to talk to you I've heard bad things about you.<BR>> After that the Ovilus said rather nasty things to her and she started<BR>> feeling nauseous and she ripped the headphones off her head. Needless<BR>> to say we ended the session and got out of there.<BR>><BR>> Over the course of our investigation we found that the Ovilus was<BR>> saying many words that are not on the 500 word list, so yesterday I<BR>> did some test recordings to see what words would come up and one of<BR>> the first things that came up was: seth blamed rest I am not<BR>> gare demon (all in that order). Needless to say this has me<BR>> concerned that whatever seth is is still with the box so I am not even<BR>> storing this thing inside of my house. I have
 an MP3 of the ovilus<BR>> saying this.<BR>><BR>> Also from my experience about 50% of the words it is saying aren't on<BR>> the list. Chris Fleming has been getting words not on the list, and<BR>> Barry FitzGerald has stated that just over 50% of the words he is<BR>> getting are not on the list. Is there really a much larger list than<BR>> advertised or is this thing really magic? Highly doubtful IMO.<BR>><BR>> My most important question is is anyone else getting the name Seth out<BR>> of the Ovilus? How many people use this device here?<BR>><BR>><BR><BR></DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></td></tr></table><br>
